page.title: 12MR SNOW
page.content: Mr.Snow is a shepherd at Standard Hill Farm; he looks after 900 sheep.The sheep year begins in the Autumn when the Rams are put in with the Ewes.It is important that the sheep have good grazing at this time of the year to keep them in good condition.By the beginning of January half the Ewes are yarded under cover with straw bedding that is littered daily.They are now fed a ration of concentrates,crushed oats, barley, protein pellets and minerals and as much hay as they need. At the 12th of March the Lambing season begins. The next job is to ring the new lambs and number them so that if a lamb gets lost you can always find its mother. About 700 out of 900 have twins.
